channel.title: macos on Memo Tut
channel.description: Recent content in macos on Memo Tut

item.title: [Python] Run toio core cube on Windows 10/macOS/Linux with Python library bleak
item.description: # I want to run the toio core cube on a familiar PC The toio core cube is a “very cute” two-wheeled robot that can be controlled by BLE communication. https://toio.github.io/toio-spec/ The other day, I tried to write a story of trying to move the toio core cube directly using BLE communication with a smartphone, but this time using a personal computer I will move the toio core cube.

item.title: [Python] Set up Django development environment using homebrew on MacOSX Mavericks (10.9)
item.description: ## I was annoyed by ImportError Install python with homebrew and django with pip. However, it fails when the server starts. $ python manage.py runserver ImportError: No module named django.core.management Actually, Python is included in the Mac from the beginning Launch the Terminal app and check the version $ python --version Python 2.7.5 I didn’t notice this, and I thought it was Python installed with homebrew.
